titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1613) to amend the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to provide for the proper Federal management and oversight of transboundary hydrocarbon reservoirs, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2231) to amend the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to increase energy exploration and production on the Outer Continental Shelf, provide for equitable revenue sharing for all coastal States, implement the reorganization of the functions of the former Minerals Management Service into distinct and separate agencies, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2410) making appropriations for Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2014, and for other purposes; providing for proceedings during the period from June 29, 2013, through July 5, 2013; and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-131, by Mr. Bishop (UT).
Resolution provides for 3 separate measures and for proceedings during the period from June 29, 2013 through July 5, 2013.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 35.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 274.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 228 - 194 (Roll no. 289).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 235 - 187 (Roll no. 290).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/25/2013--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1613) to amend the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to provide for the proper Federal management and oversight of transboundary hydrocarbon reservoirs, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2231) to amend the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to increase energy exploration and production on the Outer Continental Shelf, provide for equitable revenue sharing for all coastal States, implement the reorganization of the functions of the former Minerals Management Service into distinct and separate agencies, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2410) making appropriations for Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2014, and for other purposes; providing for proceedings during the period from June 29, 2013, through July 5, 2013.
